fields.headline: News in brief
fields.bodyText: Loco-Motion singer Little Eva dies at 59 US singer Little Eva, 59, best known for her hit The Loco-Motion , has died in a North Carolina hospital of cancer. She was babysitting for songwriters Carole King and Gerry Goffin in 1962 when they asked her to record the song. As well as being a hit for Little Eva that year, versions by Grand Funk Railroad in 1974 and Kylie Minogue in 1988 also entered the charts. Closer to sainthood The Vatican moved the last Emperor of Austria-Hungary, Charles I, on the path to beatification by approving his 'heroic virtue', one stage before beatification - the last formal step in the Roman Catholic Church before sainthood. Beatification requires evidence of a miracle. Charles I abdicated as Habsburg ruler in 1918, and died in exile in Portugal in 1922. Black Sea heroin raid Four men have been charged after police found 174kg of heroin in the largest-ever seizure of the drug in Romania. The four were arrested in the Black Sea port of Constanta after the drugs were found hidden in a truck loaded with detergent boxes. Nigeria votes Nigeria's legislative elections, an important test for civilian rule, began with only minor delays despite threats by ethnic militants to disrupt voting. Violence has marred the race leading up to the vote for 469 seats in the House of Representatives and Senate.
